data.title: Lots of food
data.text: This buffet was ok. We went here and there are lots of things to try. For some reason it would not be one of our favorite places to eat, but there were a lot of people there, enjoying their food.

data.title: Not quite
data.text: It's just okay, not quite satisfying to my taste. I'd think that they could offer better customer service and make this place more appetizing. It was one hot afternoon when we came in here, There weren't that many people but, it felt like the whole place was congested/stuffy. Don't even know if they have their AC on. Overall, o could only give 3/5.

data.title: Weekdays $8.50 lunch $11.50 dinner
data.text: Lots of choices, not all of them clearly labeled, and some not fresh (hot and cold). Excellent/fresh rice, broccoli, and green beans. Service was very good. The other thing that jumped out at me was the B health grade in the window.

data.title: Not bad but not good either
data.text: Some food were not warm enough. They taste okay. They didn't have general tsao, coconut and sesame chicken at the time which I think should be staples in chinese buffets.

data.title: Not the best buffet
data.text: This place has a huge variety of food, Chinese, Mongolian, sushi, American, seafood, salads, deserts, etc. Unfortunately the quality of the food is very low, the cleanliness of the place is questionable, most of the food is at room temperature and the service is pretty bad. It is cheap ($8 for lunch) and if you are hungry it could be your place.

data.title: food for all tasts
data.text: it is a family affair eating place rather if you are alone or in a group the food was heated or chilled at what I would say is the proper temp. those that waited on the tables cleared the all used plates that was used asked if any one needed any thing and was willing to bring the right amount that was ask for and the seniors  and those with handicaps problems  was well pleased

data.title: Birthday Bash
data.text: Great selection of food but much better on weekends, lots of seafood choices. Food taste great, been back here almost once a month for the past six months.

data.title: variety
data.text:
Huge selection of buffet with Hibachi and crepe station.
Also they had a sushi counter. The concern was that it was along with the dessert counter.
The other point that there was no one at the crepe station . well you go and stand there and then someone comes.

Rest was fine

data.title: Average Buffet
data.text: We came here on New Years' Day for dinner based on reviews from my other relatives. We didn't have to wait at all to be seated as there are lots of tables. We were a family of 8 so it wasn't hard to seat us. The place looks clean and you constantly see someone wiping down the buffet line. However the food itself was just average. Typical "Chinese American" fare such as lo mein, mayo shrimp, stir fried green beans were available. I personally liked the steamed mussels and crab legs. Though it took a lot of work to get a little bit of meat from the crab legs. Other than that, the food was pretty mediocre. The sushi bar had very limited variety, most of it were variation of the california roll with two or three sashimi rolls and 2 raw rolls. I tried a raw roll and personally thought the fish tasted kind of weird, perhaps frozen or just not higher quality? I shouldn't expect much from a buffet but honestly, Hokkaido is better in variety. The dessert/fruit bar was okay. Fruit wasn't ripe and you can definitely tell which fruit was from a can. Despite the food taste, I had an okay time here. The service was great, the waiter was very patient in taking our drink orders and bringing us napkins and other things. The bathroom here wasn't very clean either. The value of the meal was surprisingly cheap, so that's a plus for this place. If you are coming by car, there's lots of parking spaces available since the restaurant is located in a plaza.

data.title: Great food for the price!
data.text: The restaurant is located at a small shopping plaza in Norwalk.  They serve a wide variety of fruits, vegetables, grilled meat and seafood.  They have a salad bar, a sushi bar and a dessert bar. You can also order a crepe or a Mongolian plate and it will be prepared while you wait.  They replenish the food as soon as it runs out and they also change the serving spoons at the same time.  They wipe the counters clean and clear the tables frequently.  The servers are quick and very helpful.  They always ask if you need something else.  If you are in the area have lunch there instead of going to a fast food restaurant.  You get more value for your money. They don't accept reservations unless it is a group of 30 or more, so I heard.    I will definitely go back there.

data.title: Good value, crowded on weekends.
data.text: Our teens love this place, I think its average. There is a wide variety of food. The vegetables and fruits are fresh. Large variety of hot asian dishes, some are so so but alot are very good. Generally the turnover of food is quick enough so the food thats out, is fresh. Theres a little sushi bar and its good. Two things of concern is the employees, are generally unhappy and not organized, especially when busy on weekends. On weekends and evening, you can have a plate of meat and noodles cooked to order, at the grill station. Usually one guy is there and I feel for him but he is not a happy camper, and unless you have alot of patients, or if you get extremely lucky and there is no more than 2 in line, stay away, from that station. Also this place is getting ripped off!! You do not pay until after your meal, at the register by the door, where theres a unorganized maze of customers. I hope the owners read this, and go to hometown buffet, or golden corral, and other successful value buffets, and how people pay, when they first come in, in a orderly fashion! That way you can take pressure off your employees, and keep your profit up!  Good luck!!!
